title: Expect a global representation of buyers at ibtm world event program
text:
Expect a global representation of buyers at ibtm world event program Adv: 
Jul 15, 2015 Adv: 
“The initiative we implemented last year, to meet association planners’ needs at trade shows, garnered support from the industry across the world and attracted a truly global representation of buyers. Last year’s show saw the highest number of independent association planners from individual associations and societies, up 12% on 2013,” said Graeme Barnett, Senior Exhibition Director at ibtm world, commenting on the return of a popular event program. 
Following on from the success of the My Association | My Club, an initiative launched for the association sector last year by ibtm world (formerly EIBTM), the leading global event for the meetings and events industry will deliver an international Hosted Buyer Program dedicated to association meeting planners at the show, which will take place in Barcelona from November 17-19. My Association | My Club is set to once again deliver a flexible option to an association planner’s business and networking agenda at ibtm world. 
Mr. Thomas Jordan, Chief of Staff, International Union of Police Associations, United States, commented: “The show created so many opportunities in 3 short days to get things rolling for us on many levels. Relationship building, meeting topics that we had not previously thought of and destinations we hadn't even considered.” 
Association Hosted Buyers are invited to apply to join the club at ibtm world, which last year welcomed members from over 20 countries including the US, China, the UK, Canada, Russia, Switzerland, The Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, and France. 
Barnett continued: “Whilst Association Planners will continue to benefit from education tailored towards their job roles and business requirements, they will also have the flexibility to attend any of the ibtm world Knowledge Program, which will cover a wide variety of topics suitable to any event professional. 
“Further to this, they will benefit from a personalized diary of pre-scheduled appointments with a choice from 3,000 international industry suppliers and leading destinations, exclusive access to Hosted Buyer lounges on the show floor with complimentary refreshments, lunch and Wi-Fi and complimentary travel and 4/5 dedicated accommodation, which is shared with other members of My Association Club.” 
Jeton Iseni, European Project Manager, European Huntington’s Disease Network, who attended the show last year commented: “I am very pleased with the new flexibility for Association Buyers, especially around our appointments diary. The difference is that it has given us a great opportunity and time to meet with others in the industry, share knowledge and network.” 
Suppliers can find further information on meeting with association meeting planners, here . 
eTN is a media partner for ibtm world.
